thread.title: Facebook is giving us 'Reactions' instead of a Dislike button - Tech
thread.title_full: Facebook is giving us 'Reactions' instead of a Dislike button - Tech News - Digital Spy

author: Mark Langshaw
title: Facebook is giving us 'Reactions' instead of a Dislike button - Tech
text: Facebook appears to be answering calls for a Dislike button with the launch of a new feature that lets user express a broader range of emotions on the service.According to Engadget, the social network is launching a feature called Reactions, and it promises to change the way you Like posts forever. Â© Engadget 11 things you didn't know about Facebook - from the most popular celebs to surprisingly high divorce ratesThe iconic thumbs-up icon for Like will remain, but it will be joined by emoji for expressing love, laughter, a cheeky grin, shock, and anger.With the use of emoji now widespread on social networks and communication apps, it comes as little surprise that Facebook is going down this road.Facebook will reportedly begin testing the feature in Ireland and Spain this week, but there is no word about when the rest of us will receive it.CEO Mark Zuckerberg previously hinted at the new feature when he said that users will soon be able to express a "wider range of emotions" on Facebook.
